page.title: 12EDUCATION IN LEUCHARS
page.content: Leuchars has a primary school which was built in 1965. One member of our group attended this school and Mr Marr, who showed us round was his headmaster before he moved onto Madras College, St Andrews. The school roll is 220 pupils, about 80% of whom are connected with the RAF station, which means frequent changes of pupils. We found out from local books about the earlier schools in Leuchars. In the 19th century, it is mentioned that Latin, Greek, grammar, sewing and practical mathematics were studied. Another school, the forerunner of the present modern one, was to be found on School Hill. It was the parish school, and there were other schools, some fee paying. Also mentioned is a Sunday School which was "well attended". Nowadays, most pupils like the new modern building.
